titleStmt.title: Joshua Dunn to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4952

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his excellency Thomas E Bramlitt Govr of Kentucky I brought ^several^ suits against G. W. Alford for selling whisky to Negroes he hired or kept my witnesses away I got but one tried I attemped to present him to the Grand Jury he got the witnesses out of the way we tried one case the Jury fined him fifty dollars and cost I am told his is a getting a petition to get his fine remitted I do not know what his plea is but he is selling to every Negro that applies as I will convince you when I get my cases all up I will attempt to get him before the Grand Jury again his object is to keep the Witnesses away but I will summons this Summer to be in time
